6.23.7  Transforming arccos into arcsin: acos2asin

The acos2asin command transforms any acoss in an expression to asins, using the identity arccos(x) = π/2 − arcsin(x).

  • acos2asin takes one argument:
    expr, an expression containing inverse trigonometric functions.
  • acos2asin(expr) returns expr with any acoss replaced by the appropriate asins.


Example.
Input:

acos2asin(acos(x)+asin(x))

Output (after simplification):

π
2
